intro: Moehringia diversifolia, commonly known as the variable leaf moehringia, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are often variable in shape and size, giving it the species name "diversifolia," which translates to "varied leaf." Moehringia diversifolia is generally found at high elevations, often in open habitats such as meadows and slopes.
